docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 5. -- The Pan American Conference devoted its activities today to organizing its committees. Then its members attended a state dinner tonight given by President Gabriel Terra of Uruguay at the Legislative Palace.

docs.snippet: The bo market on the Stock Exchange was regular yesterday in the absence of any important change in the value of the dollar against leading foreign exchange rates. United States Government bonds closed irregularly lower, 22-32 point down to 3-32...
docs.lead_paragraph: The bo market on the Stock Exchange was regular yesterday in the absence of any important change in the value of the dollar against leading foreign exchange rates. United States Government bonds closed irregularly lower, 22-32 point down to 3-32 point up, as leading foreign loans pointed higher.

headline.main: BOND PRICES MIXED, FEDERAL LIST OFF; Rails and Industrials Average Lower on Stock Exchange, Utilities Higher. GAINS IN FOREIGN LOANS Gold-Bloc Nations' Issues Strong, Australian Obligations Rise -- Movement Similar on Curb.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 8. -- A plenary session of the Inter-American Commission of Women adopted today recommendations for presentation to the Pan-American Conference. The commission will ask the conference members to sign a convention granting equal...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 8. -- A plenary session of the Inter-American Commission of Women adopted today recommendations for presentation to the Pan-American Conference. The commission will ask the conference members to sign a convention granting equal nationality status to men and women and a treaty guaranteeing to women equal civic and political rights with men throughout the Americas.

headline.main: WOMEN ASK PACTS EQUALIZING RIGHTS; The Inter-American Group at Montevideo Demands End of 'Slave' Status. LISTS LEGAL DISABILITIES Commission Urges a Single Standard in Nationality and Civic Matters.

byline.original: By HAROLD B. HINTON.Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 8. -- Foreign Minister Saavedra Lamas of Argentina was the day's hero at the Pan-American Conference. He received a tremendous ovation when he finished reading his anti-war pact into the record. It was the only thrilling incident in...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 8. -- Foreign Minister Saavedra Lamas of Argentina was the day's hero at the Pan-American Conference. He received a tremendous ovation when he finished reading his anti-war pact into the record. It was the only thrilling incident in a day devoted to committee meetings, handling routine matters.
docs.abstract: Anti-war pact read by Argentine delegate at Pan Amer Conf; ovation

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 9. -- President Gabriel Terra of Uruguay has begun direct personal conversations with the chiefs of the Bolivian and Paraguayan delegations to the Pan-American conference in an effort to establish immediate peace in the Chaco.
